intro: Tetramerium odoratissimum, commonly known as the sweet-smelling tetramerium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a fragrant scent when crushed. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, and the plant produces small, round berries that are edible.
